availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Holman Hanks (Anderson County, KY, attorney, politician, and farmer)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret R. Myers Hanks in 1858. Elected to the House of Representatives for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Anderson County from 1849-1850. Clerk of the Anderson Circuit Court from 1856 to 1862. Farmer in Anderson County in 1860. County attorney in Anderson County from 1863 to 1867. Owned nine enslaved persons in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 414.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 3.
Find A Grave, "Thos. H. Hanks (Nov. 6. 1823- Oct. 15. 1897)," Memorial #47342184, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47342184 (May 9, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Anderson County, Marriages, Film #001550673, p. 236.
Levin, H., Du Relle, G.The lawyers and lawmakers of Kentucky. Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897, p. 516-517.
